name: Path T NET Colon
title: Pathologic T
notes:
**Note 1:** TNM does not include an in situ category for colon Neuroendocrine (NET) Tumors. Assign 88 and behavior code /2 for in situ tumors.

**Note 2:**  Ignore intraluminal extension to adjacent segment(s) of colon/rectum or to the ileum from the cecum; code depth of invasion or extracolonic spread as indicated.
rows:
Surgical resection of primary tumor done and extension not stated or unknown
Surgical resection of primary tumor done and extension not documented in patient record
Surgical resection of primary tumor done, size is part of the T definition and the size is not available but information states that the tumor is confined to the primary

Tumor invades lamina propria or submucosa and is 
no greater than 2 cm in size
Tumor less than 1 cm in size

Tumor invades muscularis propria or is greater than
2 cm in size

Muscularis propria invaded

Stated as T2

Tumor invades subserosa, or non-peritonealized  
pericolic or perirectal tissues

Extension through wall, NOS
Through muscularis propria or muscularis, NOS
Non-peritonealized pericolic tissues invaded
Perimuscular tissue invaded
Subserosal tissue/(sub)serosal fat invaded
Transmural, NOS

Extension to:
    All colon sites:
        Adjacent tissue(s), NOS
        Connective tissue
        Mesenteric fat
        Mesentery 
        Mesocolon
        Pericolic fat
    Ascending and descending colon:
        Retroperitoneal fat 
    Transverse colon/flexures:
        Gastrocolic ligament
        Greater omentum

Fat, NOS

Stated as T3
Tumor perforates peritoneum or invades other organs

Invasion of/through serosa (mesothelium) (visceral peritoneum)

Adherent to other organs or structures, NOS
All colon sites:
    Abdominal wall 
    Adrenal (suprarenal) gland
    Bladder
    Diaphragm
    Fistula to skin
    Gallbladder
    Other segment(s) of colon via serosa
    Small intestine
    Retroperitoneum (excluding fat)

Cecum (C180):
    Fallopian tube
    Greater omentum
    Ovary
    Uterus

Ascending colon (C182):
    Greater omentum
    Liver, right lobe
    Right kidney
    Right ureter
Transverse colon and flexures (C183, C184, C185):
    Gallbladder/bile ducts
    Kidney
    Liver
    Pancreas
    Spleen
    Stomach
Descending colon (C186):
    Fallopian tube
    Greater omentum
    Left kidney
    Left ureter
    Ovary
    Pelvic wall
    Spleen
    Uterus

Sigmoid colon (C187):
    Fallopian tube    
    Greater omentum
    Ovary
    Pelvic wall
    Uterus

Further contiguous extension:
    Cecum (C180):
        Kidney
        Liver
        Ureter
    Transverse colon and flexures (C183, C184, C185):
        Ureter
    Sigmoid colon (C187):
        Cul de sac (rectouterine pouch)
        Ureter
Other contiguous extension

Stated as T4

Pathologic T is not defined for this site/histology
In situ (no Tis not defined)

No pathologic evaluation
No surgical resection of primary
Only positive biopsy of primary which is not the highest T
Unknown if any pathologic assessment performed
